sentence: Stock futures are cautiously higher this morning led by gains in the retail sector as better than expected earnings from Best Buy ( BBY ), Urban Outfitters ( URBN ) and Home Depot ( HD ) gives the broader markets a much needed shot in the arm.

While there is still a lack of conviction to cause a complete reversal in the market, this morning's upbeat sentiment could mitigate any aggressive selling pressure into tomorrow's FOMC minutes which continues to weigh heavily on the financial markets.
European bourses were all lower as activity continues to be stymied by the upcoming FOMC release.
The lack of any significant economic data from the EU contributed to the sluggish tone with very little data to offer any upside direction except tame inflation data from Germany.
European bond yields, however, are down as much as 5 basis points as a result of the continued pressure on equities.

BBY (+10.51%) The stock surged to a 2-1/2 year high on much better than expected Q2 earnings

JCP (+6.58%) Despite disappointing earnings, the stock is higher thanks to reports that hedge fund manager Kyle Bass is taking a large position in the retailer

BKS (-11.82%) Reported a wider than expected Q1 loss and shareholder Leonard Riggio suspends plans to buy the company's retail business

PNRA (-0.67%) The stock is downgraded by Jefferies from Buy to Hold

The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
